alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Wrangell; Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 5:55AM AKST until January 22 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL PANHANDLE... .Snowfall continues across the panhandle. Dry snow will become wetter through the event with central areas of the panhandle changing to freezing rain and rain. For northern areas, it is possible that snow lasts longer into Tuesday morning. Freezing rain may mix in with snow across parts of the central and northern panhandle. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of less than one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Petersburg and Wrangell. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Horizontal surfaces may become very slippery under a thin glaze of ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will warm through the daytime, ultimately resulting in freezing rain and snow becoming rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
